image.altText: a bus and a bike on the ground

props.synopsis: The boy was riding his bike when he was struck in Buderim on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Boy, 11, killed after being hit by school bus while riding his bike at Sunshine Coast

image.altText: A man in a dark suit and striped neck-tie speaks with a stern expression

props.synopsis: The union's Victorian branch has been referred to the state's corruption watchdog after reports from Nine newspapers that alleged underworld figures and bikie gang members had infiltrated major construction projects.

title.children: Queensland premier won't accept CFMEU donations while southern branches probed

image.altText: A woman with brown hair and a green shirt in a country pub.

props.synopsis: A Russian-born soldier arrested on espionage charges has documented her recent visit to the sensitive Woomera military training area on a social media account which she also uses to monitor news from her country of birth.

title.children: Suspected army spy's Instagram page reveals visit to sensitive Woomera military training area

image.altText: A little girl with a pink cap, smiling

props.synopsis: The child was taken to hospital by her father in 2019, three years before her death, weighing just 13 kilograms.

title.children: Eizabeth Struhs was 'emaciated, malnourished' in hospital admission three years before her death, clinician tells court

image.altText: A courthouse sketch of fourteen people sitting in a court gallery.

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Struhs, who was a type 1 diabetic, died in her Toowoomba home in January 2022 after she stopped receiving her insulin injections.

title.children: Father tells court son's views 'gradually became more and more extreme' after joining Toowoomba 'cult'

image.altText: Sally McManus standing in front of an ACTU banner.

props.synopsis: ACTU secretary Sally McManus denies prior knowledge of alleged criminality within the CFMEU as politicians come under fire over letters sent in 2022.

title.children: Sally McManus issues multiple denials over allegations she knew of alleged criminality in CFMEU

image.altText: Gareth SOuthgate looks glum

props.synopsis: The decision comes days after England lost 2-1 to Spain in the final of the European Championship in Germany.

title.children: Gareth Southgate resigns as England football manager after Euro 2024 loss

image.altText: Trump with a bandage over his ear in a suit.

props.synopsis: A bandaged Donald Trump makes his first public appearance since his attempted assassination, and a running mate with a surprising past is announced. These are the big moments from the Republican convention's first day.

title.children: How Trump's bandaged ear stole the show on day one of the Republican convention

image.altText: A man in a suit with a bandaged ear

props.synopsis: Campaigning politicians and sitting presidents have been killed and attacked, and while there have been pleas for unity from both sides, there is little to suggest the heated and divisive nature of politics will ease.

title.children: Trump's near-assassination is part of long history of violence in the US. Here's why this feels different

image.altText: A close up of a man with in a suit & tie smiling at the camera. Around him are the stars and stripes of the US flag.

props.synopsis: Trump's march to re-take the White House continues with renewed determination. If he wins he'll have an "army" of 10,000 recruits at his disposal to help implement his controversial agenda.

title.children: If all goes to plan this man will make Donald Trump one of the most powerful presidents of all time

image.altText: A West Coast AFL player lies on the ground after being tackled as a Brisbane forward lies on top of him.

props.synopsis: GWS's Toby Bedford has joined Brisbane Lions star Charlie Cameron in failing to overturn a three-game ban at the AFL Tribunal for tackling.

title.children: Giants' Bedford and Lions' Cameron have bans upheld at AFL Tribunal

image.altText: Dozens of hens with glossy brown feathers and red plump combs under a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: Australia is in the grip of an unprecedented bird flu outbreak, with authorities this week confirming we've never seen so many strains appear at once.

title.children: Why the current bird flu outbreak is unlike others we've had in the past

image.altText: Image of one of the poisoned trees.

props.synopsis: An investigation has been launched into the deliberate poisoning of 69 native jarrah and marri trees in Western Australia, north of Albany.

title.children: Nearly 70 native trees in WA poisoned with herbicide in 'reprehensible' act of vandalism

image.altText: Jack Black and Kyle Gass of Tenacious D play guitars. Black holds up the devil horns sign with his fingers.

props.synopsis: Tenacious D have postponed the third leg of their sold out tour as the internet erupts over a controversial joke at the band's recent Sydney show.

title.children: Tenacious D postpone Newcastle concert amid Trump joke controversy

image.altText: Two men at a press conference

props.synopsis: Barry O'Rourke has admitted to using the electoral roll to find the addresses of people he says wrote abusive comments on his social media pages, claiming it led to "perfectly polite and friendly" discussions.

title.children: Queensland MP defends use of electoral roll to doorknock social media bullies

image.altText: Millaa Millaa Falls in Far North Queensland

props.synopsis: Police say one man went to help another after he got into difficulty in the water, and their companion witnessed their deaths. The incident happened at a popular swimming spot where there have been no deaths for many years.

title.children: Two swimmers drown at Far North Queensland waterfall

image.altText: a gas exploration well with drill rig and equipment.

props.synopsis: ANZ, NAB, Westpac and CommBank collectively loaned billions to companies such as Santos and Woodside to expand or operate oil, gas and coal projects.

title.children: Major banks lent $3.6b to fossil fuel projects in 2023 using a 'back door'

image.altText: Man walking into court holding documents and covering his face with an umbrella.

props.synopsis: A woman has told a court Tasmanian Supreme Court justice Gregory Geason was "venomous" and verbally abusive towards her. She has detailed an alleged assault he perpetrated against her, which left her with a head injury.

title.children: 'I just remember flying backwards': Woman tells court of alleged assault by Supreme Court judge

image.altText: Hawkei protective vehicles in camoflague sit on a lawn

props.synopsis: The federal government stopped accepting the Hawkeis in 2020, despite a $1.3 billion contract to roll out 1,100 vehicles to the Australian Defence Force.

title.children: Fix found for braking issue that resulted in hundreds of Hawkei military vehicles sitting idle

image.altText: An aerial view showing farmland and all of the development around it with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: The heartbroken family of Maroochydore's last farmer has put all of a prime parcel of farmland up for sale as they navigate life after Peter Wise's death.

title.children: Family of Maroochydore's last farmer put prime land up for sale after decades of hold-outs

image.altText: Close-up shot of Scales of Justice statue in Brisbane CBD on August 1, 2018.

props.synopsis: Three months after Queensland police charged a man with child sex offences, a woman will face court accused of not reporting the alleged abuse.

title.children: Woman charged with failing to report child abuse after man's alleged sexual offences

image.altText: A graphic showing a Medicare card, $100 bills, COVID cells and scientific beakers

props.synopsis: Some Australian pathology companies engaged in widespread and "systematic rorting" at the height of the COVID-19 pandemic, with new documents revealing accusations of fraud, cost-shifting and "opportunistic" claiming.

title.children: Doctor requested 21,000 COVID tests in a single day: How some pathology companies 'rorted' Medicare during the pandemic

image.altText: A hole on the moon.

props.synopsis: Scientists say a cave found on the Moon with a consistent temperature of 17C, making it suitable for humans to inhabit.

title.children: The perfect location for a lunar base: Atop a mysterious moon cave

image.altText: An old photograph of a young man with olive skin, floppy brown hair and a beaming smile, sitting under a willow tree.

props.synopsis: Barry McCluskey was the first known Australian nurse to contract HIV, but he never let his illness define him.

title.children: In 1985, a newspaper outed Barry's HIV status in his regional town. It was the start of years of abuse

image.altText: Man and woman smiling, standing side by side in front of their home

props.synopsis: Data on property prices and regional migration shows Australians are once again moving out of the capital cities, with millennials leading the way. But the trend is pushing up property prices, in what experts are describing as a "boomerang" effect post-pandemic.

title.children: Escaping the rat race and rental rut of city life, millennials are on the move again

image.altText: Three workers on long wires strung over water to a pylon in the distance.

props.synopsis: While Australia debates the merits of going nuclear and frustration grows over the slower-than-needed switch to solar and wind power, China's renewables rollout is breaking all the records.

title.children: 'Winning the race': How China plans to meet its 2030 renewables target by the end of this month

image.altText: A video still of a tsunami wave coming over a wall and sending up a big spray of water. The blue ocean is in the background

props.synopsis: As the sun crested the horizon on Boxing Day 20 years ago, these Australians holidaying in Thailand had no idea their lives were about to be engulfed by chaos. This is what they remember about that day.

title.children: 'It was like a bomb': How the Boxing Day tsunami unfolded 20 years ago

image.altText: A bald man wearing a black piece of strapping tape around his head with a black t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Norm Hewitt died in Wellington on Monday night aged 55 of motor neurone disease.

title.children: Former All Blacks player Norm Hewitt dies of motor neurone disease

image.altText: A man with full beard and moustache stands agaainst a black background

props.synopsis: Donald Trump selects Ohio senator JD Vance as his running mate, at the beginning of a four-day Republican National Convention to confirm the party's presidential ticket.

title.children: JD Vance once called Trump 'America's Hitler'. Today he's his vice-presidential nominee

image.altText: Jeramiah Manele shakes hands with Xi Jinping standing in front of the flags of Solomon Islands and China

props.synopsis: Jeremiah Manele praised China and indicated his country was keen to extend security and policing partnerships with the regional power — but will his words translate to more deals?

title.children: On a trip to China, Solomon Islands' PM visited a shining example of Australia's concerns about Pacific security

image.altText: The black metal gate of a housing estate with the words "Lifestyle Wollert" on a wall.

props.synopsis: Lifestyle Communities share price plunges more than 18 per cent in the wake of an ABC investigation detailing claims the operator of gated communities for the over 50s is gouging residents with unfair fees including charging the dead rent.

title.children: Investors slash more than $200 million from value of land lease operator after ABC investigation

image.altText: One of the workers is seen with an orange hood and visor on, while the other is in a white protective suit

props.synopsis: Even without nuclear power and submarines in use, the nation is already producing, processing and storing radioactive waste.

title.children: Australia's nuclear waste legacy is hidden in plain sight

image.altText: Ben Hunt points and shouts as his Queensland Maroons teammates celebrate with him during a State of Origin game.

props.synopsis: The tough Maroons hooker from the outback is set to join the likes of Wally Lewis and Mal Meninga in Queensland's esteemed 20-game club tomorrow night, earning himself the prestigious Dick Turner Medal.

title.children: Ben Hunt tried to cut the plaster off a broken arm to play footy at 13. Now, he's about to play his 20th Origin game
